issue.title: [Packaging] Provide APT and Yum repositories
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-1349](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1349). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
We have .deb and .rpm packages.
Here are needed information to provide APT and Yum repositories:

- PGP key to sign packages
- Upload location

Who does know/decide them?

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1349?focusedCommentId=16210437) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
Is this now completed?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1349?focusedCommentId=16211119) by Kouhei Sutou (kou):*
No.
We don't provide the "official" APT and Yum repositories yet.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1349?focusedCommentId=16211120) by Kouhei Sutou (kou):*
We only have "unofficial" APT and Yum repositories on packages.red-data-tools.org.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1349?focusedCommentId=16657272) by Krisztian Szucs (kszucs):*
What would "official" mean? Does Apache INFRA has a solution for it?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1349?focusedCommentId=16657863) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
Not sure. Perhaps we can search if any other projects have provided deb/rpm packages outside of the mainline Linux package managers

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1349?focusedCommentId=16658016) by Kouhei Sutou (kou):*
I'm working on supporting APT/Yum repositories on <https://bintray.com/apache/arrow> . Please wait a while.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1349?focusedCommentId=16669700) by Kouhei Sutou (kou):*
https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2879 includes works for this.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1349?focusedCommentId=16761435) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
Can this be resolved?
